page.title: 13Yews Farm (II)
page.content: It was Mr Crawley's grandfather who decided to move to Yews Farm. He had cattle, pigs, sheep and horses then. The horses were used to pull the old plough. Then tractors came into use and the Crawleys decided to have a small company that made tractors. They were doing well but they, along with other small companies, were overtaken by Ford and their tractors no longer paid. The Crawleys can shop in Hadstock, but for their main shopping they will go to Haverhill, Cambridge or Bishops Stortford, all of which are about the same distance away.
